name: Trivial Madness Quiz | TV & Movies Mixture | 10 Questions

questions.text: What was Jamie and Paul's last name on the TV show "Mad about You"?
questions.explanation:
Buchman.

	Helen Hunt and Paul Reiser played the couple in this very funny show about a married couple living in NYC.

questions.text: There was a movie called "The Madness of King Henry"?
questions.explanation:
false.

	There was a movie released in 1994 titled "The Madness of King George", which chronicled the life of King George III of England.

questions.text: What was the name of the mermaid in the 1984 movie "Splash".
questions.explanation:
Madison.

	Darryl Hannah's character decided she liked the name Madison, when she asked Allen (Tom Hanks) what street they were on. This wonderfully funny movie was released in 1984 and was directed by Ron Howard.

questions.text: Who played Oscar Madison in the 1968 movie "The Odd Couple"?
questions.explanation:
Walter Matthau.

	Matthau and Lemmon reprised their original roles in the sequel "The Odd Couple 2", which was released 30 years later in 1998.

questions.text: Whose second album was, "Diary of a Madman?"
questions.explanation:
Ozzy Osbourne.

	Ozzy's second solo album "Diary of a Madman" was released in 1981.

questions.text: In what year was the first Mad Magazine published?
questions.explanation:
1952.

	Alfred E. Neuman didn't appear on the magazine cover for the first few years. His name and face have now become Mad's famous trademark.

questions.text: Who recorded the album "Mad Dogs and Englishmen"?
questions.explanation:
Joe Cocker.

	This 1970 album included a remake of The Beatles "She Came in Through the Bathroom Window". Joe Cocker's 1971 concert/documentary movie was also titled "Mad Dogs and Englishmen".

questions.text: The movie "Rat Race" (2001) was a remake of what movie?
questions.correct: It's a Mad, Mad, Mad, Mad World
questions.explanation:
It's a Mad, Mad, Mad, Mad World.

	This hysterical 1963 movie co-starred many movie stars, including Spencer Tracy, Milton Berle, Syd Caesar, Buddy Hackett and many, many more stars.

questions.text: From what movie would you hear the famous quote "I'm mad as hell and I'm not going to take it anymore!"
questions.explanation:
Network.

	These words were first uttered by actor Peter Finch who played an anchorman who has a mental breakdown while on the air. Sadly, Peter Finch had passed away prior to the Academy Awards, but still won the  award for Best Actor. He is the only actor to have won an Oscar after his death.

questions.text: Who provided the voice for the Mad Hatter in the 1951 Disney version of "Alice in Wonderland"?
questions.explanation:
Ed Wynn.

	Ed Wynn also had a small part as Uncle Albert in the 1964 Disney movie "Mary Poppins".
